title: Miles Davis Fillmore East (March 7, 1970) It's About That Time
description:
This is Wayne Shorter's last live date with the Sextet. Miles Davis opened for Neil Young and Crazy Horse and The Steve Miller Blues Band for two nights at the Fillmore East, March 6 & 7 (Friday & Saturday). There were two shows each night. Columbia recorded both nights, but for some reason they decided to issue only the music from Saturday's show.

Leaning heavily on the soon-to-be-released Bitches Brew, these 2 shows capture Miles heading in the direction of Jack Johnson, stopping to give the rock audience a glimpse of himself working at another peak. As Miles said, this was "a mother of a band" - amongst his best.

The music is as exciting, revelatory, and dangerous today as it was on March 7, 1970. ItÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s about that time.

Wayne Shorter: soprano and tenor saxophone

Chick Corea: Fender Rhodes electric piano

Dave Holland: acoustic and electric bass

Jack DeJohnette: drums

Airto Moreira: percussion
